Title: Groovy: Arbitrary code execution
Synopsis:
Groovy is vulnerable to a remote execution of arbitrary code when
    java serialization is used.

Background.Text: A multi-faceted language for the Java platform

Description.Text: Groovyâ€™s MethodClosure class, in runtime/MethodClosure.java, is vulnerable to a crafted serialized object.

Impact.Text: Remote attackers could potentially execute arbitrary code, or cause Denial of Service condition

Workaround.Text: A workaround exists by using a custom security policy file utilizing the standard Java security manager, or do not rely on serialization to communicate remotely.

P.Text: All Groovy users should upgrade to the latest version:
